Package group10.client.service

Class HTTPService

java.lang.Object
group10.client.service.HTTPService
@Service public class HTTPService extends Object
Singleton Service class that is responsible of sending HTTP requests to server. Acts as a wrapper class.
Author:
Alperen Caykus, Mustafa Ozan Alpay

  • Constructor Details

    • HTTPService

      private HTTPService()
      Private constructor for HTTPService. Initializes restTemplate and gson

  • Method Details

    • getSHA256

      private String getSHA256​(String pw)
      Helper method to hash Strings with SHA-256. Used for hashing passwords before sending them over network. However, works on any String instance.
      Parameters:
      pw - Password to be hashed with SHA-256
      Returns:
      SHA-256 Hash string of given password.

    • getInstance

      public static HTTPService getInstance()
      Creates a new HTTPService instance and assigns it to instance field. Used for singleton access.
      Returns:
      instance

    • initEntity

      private org.springframework.http.HttpEntity<String> initEntity​(boolean withToken, String json)
      Initializes a new HttpEntity and returns it.
      Parameters:
      withToken - Flag to add token header or not. Add if true, don't if false.
      json - Json body to attach to created HttpEntity.
      Returns:
      newly created HttpEntity.

    • login

      public boolean login​(Player player)
      Given a Player instance, logs in the user by sending a HTTP request to server and populates SessionStorage fields on successful login. Also logs if the operation was successful or not to console. Hashes the password with SHA-256 before sending it
      Parameters:
      player - Player to be logged in.
      Returns:
      True if login is successful, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      Player

    • register

      public String register​(Player player)
      Registers the given player by sending HTTP request. Logs if the operation was successful or not to console. Hashes the password with SHA-256 before sending it
      Parameters:
      player - Player to be registered.
      Returns:
      Empty string on success, Server error message on error.
      See Also:
      Player

    • sendCode

      public String sendCode​(PasswordReset emailContainer)
      Sends a HTTP request to server to request a password reset code to given email address. Logs the success of operation to console.
      Parameters:
      emailContainer - Object that wraps email.
      Returns:
      Error message if operation failed, Empty string if operation was successful.
      See Also:
      PasswordReset

    • updatePassword

      public String updatePassword​(PasswordReset resetForm)
      Updates the password by sending a HTTP request to server. Logs the operation success status to console. Hashes the password with SHA-256 before sending it
      Parameters:
      resetForm - Form that holds reset code, username and new password.
      Returns:
      Empty string if operation was successful, error message otherwise.
      See Also:
      PasswordReset

    • getRequest

      private String getRequest​(String url)
      Sends a get request to given URL with empty body and with token.
      Parameters:
      url - URL that the request is sent to.
      Returns:
      Server response.

    • getScoreboard

      public String getScoreboard​(long days, long page)
      Gets the scoreboard for last n days with paging
      Parameters:
      days - Last n days
      page - Requested page number.
      Returns:
      Server message.

    • startNewGame

      public String startNewGame()
      Starts a new game by sending a GET request to ServerFolders.NEW_GAME_PATH. Logs the username of the user who requested the new game to console.
      Returns:
      Server message

    • sendScores

      public PlayerGame sendScores​(Level level)
      POSTs score of the level to server. Logs username, game and score to console.
      Parameters:
      level - Level that score was calculated for.
      Returns:
      Server Response that contains player, game, level and score.
      See Also:
      PlayerGame

    • getOpponent

      public OpponentInfo getOpponent​(OpponentInfo selfInformation)
      Requests the opponent information. If an opponent is found, it returns their network and player information. If an opponent is not found, this player whose information provided as parameter is queued.
      Parameters:
      selfInformation - This player's information to queue if an opponent is not found.
      Returns:
      null if an opponent is not found. Opponent information otherwise.

    • dequeue

      public Boolean dequeue​(OpponentInfo selfInformation)
      Dequeues the user from the multiplayer queue.
      Parameters:
      selfInformation - This player's information to dequeue.
      Returns:
      True if successful, False otherwise
